definition: lit. the toad wants to eat swan meat (idiom)/fig. to try to punch above one's weight
pinyin: lai4 ha2 ma5 xiang3 chi1 tian1 e2 rou4

definition: to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130

sentences.english: He's like a toad trying to swallow a swan.
sentences.chinese: 他真是癞蛤蟆想吃天鹅肉。

sentences.english: He is like a toad trying to swallow a swan.
sentences.chinese: 他像只癞蛤蟆想吃天鹅肉。

sentences.english: Ask Mary to marry him is asking for the moon.
sentences.chinese: 他向玛丽求婚简直就是癞蛤蟆想吃天鹅肉。

sentences.english: Asking Mary to marry him is asking for the moon .
sentences.chinese: 他向玛丽求婚简直就是癞蛤蟆想吃天鹅肉。

definition: to be carried away by one's wishful thinking (idiom)/to labor under a delusion/wishful thinking
to daydream/to indulge in wishful thinking
to be unworthy to associate with (sb of higher social status)
sour grapes (set expr. based on Aesop)/lit. to say grapes are sour when you can't eat them

definition: no ivory comes from the mouth of a dog (idiom)/no good words are to be expected from a scoundrel

definition: unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
fail to appreciate sb's kindness/not know how to appreciate favors
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating

definition: country bumpkin/boor/unsophisticated country person (humble, applied to oneself)/burial mound
